usage: A chest for players to store and take treasures
interactivity: its hinged lid could be opened
interactionDeduction: Users will approach the treasure chest and use their hands to make contact with the lid. The interaction will likely involve a pressing motion to push down on the lid to open it, simulating the action of lifting a heavy lid. Users may also use their palms to slide across the surface before applying pressure. The wooden texture will provide a tactile feedback, and the chest may respond with a slight resistance before the lid opens, mimicking the feel of a real chest.

usage: players will use it to open a tresure chest
interactionDeduction: Users will grasp the key using a precision grip, holding it between their thumb and index finger. The interaction will involve a twisting motion as they insert the key into the lock of the treasure chest. The smooth texture of the key will provide a comfortable grip, and users may feel a slight click or resistance when the key engages with the lock mechanism, indicating successful insertion.

usage: players will use it to smash things
inertia: relatively heavy with the center of mass concentrated at one end
interactionDeduction: Users will grasp the hammer using a power grip, wrapping their fingers around the round handle. The interaction will involve lifting the hammer and swinging it downwards to smash objects. The relatively heavy weight, with the center of mass concentrated at one end, will provide a realistic inertia, making users feel the effort required to lift and swing it. The hammer will respond with a solid impact feedback when it strikes an object, simulating the sensation of a real hammer.

usage: players will punch it for blowing off steam
outline: the punching bag is positioned on the ground. make sure a proxy's volume covers this punching bag
hardness: feeling a little bit soft while punching
interactionDeduction: Users will approach the scarecrow punching bag and use their fists to make contact with it. The interaction will involve a punching motion, where users may throw quick jabs or sustained punches. The punching bag will feel soft upon impact, providing a slight give, which will help absorb the force of the punches. Users may also feel a slight rebound effect as the bag moves back after being struck, simulating the experience of hitting a real punching bag.
